Interface TournamentsApi

All Known Subinterfaces:
TournamentsApiAuth
public interface TournamentsApi
Access Arena and Swiss tournaments played on Lichess.
Official Arena tournaments are maintained by Lichess, but you can create your own Arena tournaments as well.

    default Many<ArenaResult>
    resultsByArenaId(String arenaId)
     
    Many<ArenaResult>
    resultsByArenaId(String arenaId, Consumer<TournamentsApi.ArenaResultParams> parameters)
    Players of an Arena tournament, with their score and performance, sorted by rank (best first).
    If called on an ongoing tournament, results can be inconsistent due to ranking changes while the players are being streamed.
    Use on finished tournaments for guaranteed consistency.
    default Many<SwissResult>
    resultsBySwissId(String swissId)
     
    Many<SwissResult>
    resultsBySwissId(String swissId, Consumer<TournamentsApi.SwissResultParams> parameters)

    If called on an ongoing tournament, results can be inconsistent due to ranking changes while the players are being streamed.
    Use on finished tournaments for guaranteed consistency.
    One<Swiss>
    swissById(String swissId)
    Get info about a Swiss tournament.
    Many<String>
    swissTRF(String swissId)
    Download a tournament in the Tournament Report File format, the FIDE standard.
    Documentation: PDF
    Example: TRF
    Many<Arena.TeamStanding>
    teamBattleResultsById(String tournamentId)
    Teams of a team battle tournament, with top players, sorted by rank (best first).

  • Method Details

    • currentTournaments

      One<TournamentStatus> currentTournaments()
      Get recently finished, ongoing, and upcoming tournaments. This API is used to display the Lichess tournament schedule.

    • arenaById

      @Deprecated default One<Arena> arenaById(String arenaId, int page)
      Deprecated.
      Use arenaById(String, Consumer)
      Get detailed info about recently finished, current, or upcoming tournament's duels, player standings, and other info.
      Parameters:
      page - Specify which page of player standings to view. [ 1 .. 200 ] Default: 1

    • arenaById

      default One<Arena> arenaById(String arenaId)
      Get detailed info about recently finished, current, or upcoming tournament's duels, player standings, and other info.

    • arenaById

      One<Arena> arenaById(String arenaId, Consumer<TournamentsApi.StandingsParams> params)
      Get detailed info about recently finished, current, or upcoming tournament's duels, player standings, and other info.

    • resultsByArenaId

      Many<ArenaResult> resultsByArenaId(String arenaId, Consumer<TournamentsApi.ArenaResultParams> parameters)
      Players of an Arena tournament, with their score and performance, sorted by rank (best first).
      If called on an ongoing tournament, results can be inconsistent due to ranking changes while the players are being streamed.
      Use on finished tournaments for guaranteed consistency. 
      List<ArenaResult> top10 = client.tournaments().resultsByArenaId("QITRjufu", params -> params.max(10)).stream().toList();

    • resultsByArenaId

      default Many<ArenaResult> resultsByArenaId(String arenaId)
      See Also:
      • resultsByArenaId(String, Consumer)

    • arenasCreatedByUserId

      Many<ArenaLight> arenasCreatedByUserId(String userId, Consumer<TournamentsApi.CreatedParams> params)
      Get tournaments created by a given user. Tournaments are sorted by reverse chronological order of start date (last starting first).
      Parameters:
      params - Optional filtering to only include tournaments of specified tournament status

    • arenasCreatedByUserId

      default Many<ArenaLight> arenasCreatedByUserId(String userId)

    • arenasCreatedByUserId

      @Deprecated default Many<ArenaLight> arenasCreatedByUserId(String userId, Set<TourInfo.Status> status)
      Deprecated.

      Deprecated.

    • resultsBySwissId

      Many<SwissResult> resultsBySwissId(String swissId, Consumer<TournamentsApi.SwissResultParams> parameters)
      Players of a swiss tournament, with their score and performance, sorted by rank (best first).
      If called on an ongoing tournament, results can be inconsistent due to ranking changes while the players are being streamed.
      Use on finished tournaments for guaranteed consistency.
      Parameters:
      parameters - 
      List<SwissResult> top10 = client.tournaments().resultsBySwissId("j8rtJ5GL", params -> params.max(10)).stream().toList();

    • resultsBySwissId
